p: As schematically shown in Fig. 3a, the EG at the CHO/STO heterointerface is used as the drain (D)-source (S) channel, and the epitaxial CHO film as gate dielectrics, for FET operations. The output characteristics, drain-source current ( I DS) versus drain-source voltage ( V DS) at different gate voltages ( V GS), are shown in Fig. 3b, c. Note that although the thickness of CHO is only 8 uc (~3.2 nm) (similar FETs with 15 uc CHO are shown in Supplementary Fig. 13), in the −4 V < V GS < 1 V range, the leakage current of the devices is very small (see Supplementary Fig. 12). In addition, we found that even increasing the size of the contact between the gate electrode and the CHO film up to several millimeter square, in the same V GS range the leakage current remains small (not shown), confirming that the CHO film of CHO/STO is very homogeneous.
